title: Electric field from electric potential - calculus

content.question: The electric potential as a function of position <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> in a region of space is given by the equation <math alttext="V of y equals 4 y squared minus 3 y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>V</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo></mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is correct for the magnitude of the electric field at position <math alttext="2 comma 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
